Post.title: Zookeeper Ephemeral
Post._content:
ZookeeperZKZKZKEphemeralZK > **P.S.:**EphemeralApache Zookeepersessionsession **** **** sessionephemeralsessionsessionexpireZKZK30s **** Apachepatchsession

1\. try { 2.   zk.delete(path) 3\. } catch { 4.   e: NoNodeException => // do nothing 5\. } 6\. zk.create(path, data, CreateMode.EPHEMERAL)

> **** > > [A Gotcha When Using ZooKeeper Ephemeral Nodes](http://developers.blog.box.com/2012/04/10/a-gotcha-when-using-zookeeper-ephemeral-nodes/) > > [ephemerals handling after restart](http://zookeeper-user.578899.n2.nabble.com/ephemerals-handling-after-restart-td1084715.html)

1. import os, sys  2.   3. # list files in root by recursion   4. def listfile(root, callback = None):   5.     for path in os.listdir(root):   6.         abs_path = os.path.join(root, path)   7.         if os.path.isdir(abs_path):   8.             listfile(abs_path, callback)   9.         else:   10.             if callback: callback(abs_path)   11.   12. #do something to the path   13. def dosth(path):   14.     print path   15.   16. if __name__ == "__main__":   17.     path = raw_input('enter your path: ')   18.     try:   19.         listfile(path, dosth)   20.     except: # Exception in permissions, sytem file etc   21.         pass 
pythonGoogleos.walk(path) os.walk()(dirpath, dirnames, filenames)dirpathdirnameslistdirpathfilenameslistdirpath dirnamesfilenamesos.path.join(path,name)
1. import os, sys  2.   3. # list files in root by os.walk()   4. def walkfile(root, callback = None):   5.     for dirpath, dirnames, filenames in os.walk(root):   6.         for filename in filenames:   7.             abs_path = os.path.join(dirpath, filename)   8.             if callback: callback(abs_path)   9.   10. #do something to the path   11. def dosth(path):   12.     print path   13.   14. if __name__ == "__main__":   15.     path = raw_input('enter your path: ')   16.     #In theory, there is no permissions/systemfile exception by os.walk   17.     walkfile(path, dosth)

1. import os, sys  2.   3. # list files in root by os.walk()   4. def walkfile(root, callback = None):   5.     for dirpath, dirnames, filenames in os.walk(root):   6.         for filename in filenames:   7.             abs_path = os.path.join(dirpath, filename)   8.             if callback: callback(abs_path)   9.   10. #do something to the path   11. def dosth(path):   12.     print path   13.   14. if __name__ == "__main__":   15.     path = raw_input('enter your path: ')   16.     #In theory, there is no permissions/systemfile exception by os.walk   17.     walkfile(path, dosth)

1. iplist=['192.168.1.33','10.5.1.3','10.5.2.4','202.98.96.68','13.12.1.1']   2. p = lambda ip: sum( [ int(k)*v for k, v in zip(ip.split('.'), [1<<24, 65536, 256, 1])]);   3. iplist.sort(lambda x, y: cmp(p(x), p(y)))   4. print iplist

Post.title: OOM Killer
Post._content: JVM VM VM JVM Bug JVM ### 1. JVM JVM dump core ``` strace -e trace=signal -o /home/admin/strace.log -p [PID]; ``` JVM ``` +++ killed by SIGKILL +++ ``` [signal - overview of signals](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/signal.7.html) SIGKILL kill -9 OS kill JVM ``` dmesg | egrep -i -B100 'killed process' [5673702.665338] [20189] 522 20189 1017 22 2 0 0 sleep [5673702.665338] [20308] 0 20308 47967 20414 3 0 0 puppet [5673702.665338] [20536] 0 20536 47969 20419 1 0 0 puppet [5673702.665338] Out of memory: Kill process 29953 (java) score 431 or sacrifice child [5673702.665338] Killed process 29953, UID 500, (java) total-vm:9805316kB, anon-rss:2344496kB, file-rss:128kB ``` Out of memory JVM kill OOM Killer OOM Killer > OOM dump pmap -x [PID]: ; jmap -heap [PID]: JVM ### 2. Linux OOM Killer VPS MySQL VPS Out of memory Linux Out of Memory (OOM) killerOOM killer `/var/log/messages` `Out of memory: Kill process` ``` ... Out of memory: Kill process 9682 (mysqld) score 9 or sacrifice child Killed process 9682, UID 27, (mysqld) total-vm:47388kB, anon-rss:3744kB, file-rss:80kB httpd invoked oom-killer: gfp_mask=0x201da, order=0, oom_adj=0, oom_score_adj=0 httpd cpuset=/ mems_allowed=0 Pid: 8911, comm: httpd Not tainted 2.6.32-279.1.1.el6.i686 #1 ... 21556 total pagecache pages 21049 pages in swap cache Swap cache stats: add 12819103, delete 12798054, find 3188096/4634617 Free swap = 0kB Total swap = 524280kB 131071 pages RAM 0 pages HighMem 3673 pages reserved 67960 pages shared 124940 pages non-shared ``` Linux over-commit memory swapOOM killer [linux/mm/oom_kill.c] (https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/master/mm/oom_kill.c)`out_of_memory()` `select_bad_process()` bad bad `oom_badness()` bad ``` c /** * oom_badness - heuristic function to determine which candidate task to kill * @p: task struct of which task we should calculate * @totalpages: total present RAM allowed for page allocation * * The heuristic for determining which task to kill is made to be as simple and * predictable as possible. The goal is to return the highest value for the * task consuming the most memory to avoid subsequent oom failures. */ unsigned long oom_badness(struct task_struct *p, struct mem_cgroup *memcg, const nodemask_t *nodemask, unsigned long totalpages) { long points; long adj; if (oom_unkillable_task(p, memcg, nodemask)) return 0; p = find_lock_task_mm(p); if (!p) return 0; adj = (long)p->signal->oom_score_adj; if (adj == OOM_SCORE_ADJ_MIN) { task_unlock(p); return 0; } /* * The baseline for the badness score is the proportion of RAM that each * task's rss, pagetable and swap space use. */ points = get_mm_rss(p->mm) + p->mm->nr_ptes + get_mm_counter(p->mm, MM_SWAPENTS); task_unlock(p); /* * Root processes get 3% bonus, just like the __vm_enough_memory() * implementation used by LSMs. */ if (has_capability_noaudit(p, CAP_SYS_ADMIN)) adj -= 30; /* Normalize to oom_score_adj units */ adj *= totalpages / 1000; points += adj; /* * Never return 0 for an eligible task regardless of the root bonus and * oom_score_adj (oom_score_adj can't be OOM_SCORE_ADJ_MIN here). */ return points > 0 ? points : 1; } ``` MySQL Out of Memeory (OOM) kill [ MySQL ](http://www.vpsee.com/2009/06/64mb-vps-optimize-mysql/) MySQL [ Debian 5](http://www.vpsee.com/2009/06/64mb-vps-optimize-debian5/)[ CentOS 5.x](http://www.vpsee.com/2009/06/128mb-vps-optimize-centos5/) MySQL) MySQL OOM killer #### 2.1 OOM killer OOM killer OOM kernel panickernel panic 10 ``` # sysctl -w vm.panic_on_oom=1 vm.panic_on_oom = 1 # sysctl -w kernel.panic=10 kernel.panic = 10 # echo "vm.panic_on_oom=1" >> /etc/sysctl.conf # echo "kernel.panic=10" >> /etc/sysctl.conf ``` oom_kill.c `oom_badness()` points points adj root 3% adj -= 30; oom_adj OOM killer MySQL MySQL oom_score_adj -15 points ``` # ps aux | grep mysqld mysql 2196 1.6 2.1 623800 44876 ? Ssl 09:42 0:00 /usr/sbin/mysqld # cat /proc/2196/oom_score_adj 0 # echo -15 > /proc/2196/oom_score_adj ``` OOM killer ``` # sysctl -w vm.overcommit_memory=2 # echo "vm.overcommit_memory=2" >> /etc/sysctl.conf ``` #### 2.2 OOM Killer oom_adj oom_score 981 omm_score omm_score_adj 153 ``` # cat /proc/981/oom_score 18 # echo -15 > /proc/981/oom_score_adj # cat /proc/981/oom_score 3 ``` bash oom_score OOM Killer ``` # vi oomscore.sh #!/bin/bash for proc in $(find /proc -maxdepth 1 -regex '/proc/[0-9]+'); do printf "%2d %5d %s\n" \ "$(cat $proc/oom_score)" \ "$(basename $proc)" \ "$(cat $proc/cmdline | tr '\0' ' ' | head -c 50)" done 2>/dev/null | sort -nr | head -n 10 # chmod +x oomscore.sh # ./oomscore.sh 18 981 /usr/sbin/mysqld 4 31359 -bash 4 31056 -bash 1 31358 sshd: root@pts/6 1 31244 sshd: vpsee [priv] 1 31159 -bash 1 31158 sudo -i 1 31055 sshd: root@pts/3 1 30912 sshd: vpsee [priv] 1 29547 /usr/sbin/sshd -D ``` > http://www.vpsee.com/2013/10/how-to-configure-the-linux-oom-killer/

Post._content:
**** Map/ReduceMapReduce Task@[lidonghua1990](http://weibo.com/getix2010)ReduceTaskReduceReduce   **** **[![clip_image001[4]](http://hongweiyi.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/clip_image0014_thumb.jpg "clip_image001[4]")](http://hongweiyi.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/clip_image0014.jpg)** -----------------------------Start-----------------------------------

******Map Phrase****** // MapTask **1\. map.run();**   |- map(getCurrentKey(), getCurrentValue(), context); // MapTask$NewOutputCollector **2\. context.write(key, value);**   |- collector.collect(key, value, partioner.getPartition()); // MapTask$MapOutputBuffer **3\. startSpill();**   |- spillReady.signal(); // spillThread is waiting   |- spillThread.sortAndSpill();   |--- sorter.sort();       // default: QuickSort.class   |--- if (combiner != null) combiner.combine();   |--- writer.close();     // flush data // MapTask$NewOutputCollector // MapTask$MapOutputBuffer **4\. output.close(context);**   |- collector.flush();   |--- SortAndSpill();    // output last mem data   |--- MergeParts();   |----- Merge.merge();  // merge and sort   |----- combinerRunner.combine(kvIter, combineCollector);

----------------------Tmp Data(On disk)------------------------------- [![Image](http://hongweiyi.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/Image_thumb.jpg "Image")](http://hongweiyi.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/Image.jpg)  

******Reduce Phrase****** // LocalJobRunner$Job **0\. reduce.run(localConf, this);** // ReduceTask **1\. reduceCopier.fetchOutputs();** // only if data is on HDFS   |- copier.start(); // **mapred.reduce.parallel.copies** MapOutputCopiers   |--- copyOutput(loc); // loc is the location in buffer   |----- getMapOutput(); // from remote host to a ramfs/localFS file   |------- // setup connection, validates header   |------- boolean shuffleInMemory = ramManager.canFitInMemory(decompressedLength); // check if data fit in mem else use localFS   |------- shuffleInMemory(); / shuffleToDisk(); // return a MapOutput   |----- // add to list (if in mem) / rename to final name (if in localFS)   |- localFSMergerThread.start(); // ReduceTask$ReduceCopier$LocalFSMerger.run()   |--- // wait if number of files < 2*ioSortFactor - 1   |--- Merger.merge(**sortSegments==true**); // merge **io.sort.factor** files ino 1   |- inMemFSMergeThread.start(); // ReduceTask$ReduceCopier$InMemFSMergeThread.run()   |--- ramManager.waitForDataToMerge();   |--- doInMemMerge();   |----- createInMemorySegments(...);   |----- Merger.merge(**sortSegments==false**);   |--- if (combinerRunner != null) combinerRunner.combine(rIter, combineCollector);   |- // schedule until get all required outputs (using exp-back-off for retries on failures) // multi-pass (**factor** segments/pass), using **hadoop.util.PriorityQueue** **2\. Merger.merge();**   |- factor = getPassFactor(); // btw: first pass is special   |- // set segmentsToMerge (sorted) and put them into PriorityQueue   |- // merge into a temp file, add to **MergeQueue.segments**, and sort   |- // loop until number of segments < factor **3\. runReducer();**

-----------------------------Done------------------------------------ **** **1****** sortAndSpill(); mappermapio.sort.mb(100MB) * io.sort.spill.percent(0.8) circle bufferhadoopcaibinbupt[1](http://caibinbupt.iteye.com/blog/402849)[2](http://caibinbupt.iteye.com/blog/402214) bytemapkv mapreducekvindiceskvpair1[partion1, key1_start, value1_start], kvpair2[partition2, key2_start, value2_start]kvoffsetskvindiceskvpairkvoffsetspartitionkeykvoffsets **[](http://hongweiyi.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/clip_image0054.jpg)** **[![Image](http://hongweiyi.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/Image_thumb1.jpg "Image")](http://hongweiyi.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/Image1.jpg)** ** 2********combine****** mapcombinemin.num.spills.for.combine3spill3 mapcombine reducecombineinMemFSMergeThread localFSMergerThreadcombinecombinereduce **3********segment********group****** **segment** mappartitionsegmentpartition0/1/2spill.outsegment segmentmapmerge spillsreducemergemapcopy [![Image](http://hongweiyi.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/Image_thumb2.jpg "Image")](http://hongweiyi.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/Image2.jpg) **group** reducereduce()groupkeygroupHadoop8 **4****** MapspillReducecopyPhrasehadoopMergerMergersegmentMerger$Segment Segment MergermergeMergeQueuemergeMergeQueuePriorityQueuehadoopMergerlessThan(a,b)segmentkeycomparatorio.sort.factor(10) **** 1**map****** map(key1, value1); (key1, value2); (key1, value3)(key1, list(value1, value2, value3)) keylistcombiner **2********mr****** **[Spark](http://www.spark-project.org/)****[Storm](https://github.com/nathanmarz/storm)** **** > [MapReduce: Shuffle](http://langyu.iteye.com/blog/992916) > > [caibinbupt](http://caibinbupt.iteye.com/blog/401374) > > hadoop P.S.: 0.20.203.0

title: MapReduce Writable tags: - Hadoop - MapReduce id: 588 categories: - date: 2012-09-27 21:44:55 --- **** MapReduce[MapReduce](http://www.hongweiyi.com/2012/02/mapred-optimize/)MR MapReduceWordCount -> -> SequenceFile4M

word1 freq1\n word2 freq2\n word3 freq3\n

******Writable** 1 2 3(word, freq)(word, ONE)

1\. String str = value.toString(); 2\. String[] ln = str.split("\n"); 3\. for(String l : ln) { 4.     String[] words = ln.split(" "); 5.     context.write(new Text(words[0]), new LongWritable(1)); 6.     context.write(new Text(words[0]), new LongWritable(Long.parseLong(words[1])); 7\. }

11valuetoStringdecodedecode 22split("\n") 356TextLongWritableGC 12decodebyteTextWritableTextnextLine()nextLine()nextWord()nextFreq() 3HadoopExampleKEYVALUEsetKEYVALUELongWritableIntWritable mapcontext.write()d_freq#freq

1\. while (value.hasNext()) { 2.     KEY.set(value.nextWord()); 3.     VALUE.set("1#" + value.nextFreq()); 4.     context.write(KEY, VALUE); 5\. }

**3.0 ****** Linux/Unix“” > 1 > > > 2 > > > 3Unix > > > 4 > > > 5 awksed   **3.1 ****** **echo****** echopythonprintecho **cat********Concatenate****** concatenatesplit **|****** Linux Linux fileVFSinode file VFS VFS [Linux](http://oss.org.cn/kernel-book/ch07/7.1.1.htm) **** >: >>: 012 2>&1linux/dev/null“” **read:** Usage: read [option] [var(default:REPLY)]
  >> $ echo "hello world" > new.txt   >> $ cat new.txt   hello world   >> $ echo "again" >> new.txt   >> $ cat new.txt   hello world   again   >> $ echo "col1 col2" | awk '{print $1}'   col1   >> $ read newline < new.txt; echo $newline   hello world   >> $ read < new.txt; echo $REPLY   hello world
> **TIPS1:** readwhilecat file | while read line; do do_sth; done; > > > **TIPS2:** 2>&1/dev/null/bin/sh your.sh > /dev/null 2>&1 > > > **TIPS3:** Linuxtouch"> newfile"   **3.2 ****** catheadtailmoreless **head(tail)** **more** q(ctrl+c) **less** moreu(up)d(down)
  >> $ tail -n 1000 file | more    # 1k   >> $ head -n 10010 file | tail     # 10k   >> $ head -c 1(b|k|m) file    # 1B|K|M
  **3.3 ****** utf8 **file:** BOMfilegbkutf8 **iconv:**
  >> $ iconv -f from_code -t to_code file
> **TIPS1:** > > > **TIPS2:** utf8gbk > > > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > >   >> $ echo -e "\n"alias conv_gbk=\"iconv -f gbk -t utf8\" >> ~/.bashrc > > >   >> $ source ~/.bashrc > > >   >> $ cat file | conv_gbk > > >
**3.4 ****** **grep:** grep
  >> $ grep [pattern] [file]    # grepfilepattern   >> $ grep -v pattern file    # filepattern   >> $ grep pattern . -r    # -r recursive pattern
**wc:** wordcount
  >> $ wc -l file    # file   >> $ ls . | wc -l    #   >> $ grep pattern file | wc -l    # filepattern
**sort:**
  >> $ sort -k n (-n) (-r) file   # nfile-n numeric-sort -r reverse   >> $ ls -l . | sort -k 5 -n    #   >> $ ls -l . | sort -k5n -k6    #
**uniq:**
  >> $ cat file   test1   test2   test2   test1   >> $ uniq file   test1   test2   test1   >> $ sort file | uniq     #   test1   test2
**diff & patch:** svndiffdiffpatch **[diffpatch](https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/cn/linux/l-diffp/)** **awk & sed:** sed(stream editor)awkawk
  >> $ echo "col1 col2 col3" | awk '{print $1"\t"$3}'    # $0 $1col1 $2col2 $3col3 ...   col1[tab]col3   >> $ echo "col1 col2 col3" | awk '{print $1, $3}'   col1[space]col3   >> $ sed -i "s/pattern/replace_pattern/g" file    #
> **WARNING:** sed -i "s/char/replace_char/g"asciigbk128sed

  #!/bin/sh   function tree_files()   {       find . -print 2>/dev/null|\       awk '!/\.$/ {for (i=1;i<NF;i++){\       d=length($i);if ( d < 5 && i != 1 )d=5;printf("%"d"s","|")}print "---"$NF}' \       FS='/' | more   }   function tree_dirs()   {       find . -type d -print 2>/dev/null|\       awk '!/\.$/ {for (i=1;i<NF;i++){\       d=length($i);if ( d < 5 && i != 1 )d=5;printf("%"d"s","|")}print "---"$NF}' \       FS='/' | more   }   function help()   {       echo "Usage: tree [-f|-d]"       echo "  -f: list files of current directory"       echo "  -d: list direcotries of current directory"   }   if [ $# = 0 ]; then       tree_dirs   elif [ $# = 1 ]; then       if [ $1 = "-f" ]; then           tree_files       elif [ $1 = "-d" ]; then           tree_dirs       else           help       fi   fi

  >> $ export PS1="\[\e[31;1m\]\u\[\e[0m\]@\[\e[32;1m\]`/sbin/ifconfig eth1|grep "inet   addr:"|cut -d: -f 2|cut -d" " -f1`\[\e[0m\]:\[\e[35;1m\]\w\[\e[0m\]\\$ "
**[Linux](http://unix-cd.com/unixcd12/article_7281.html)** PS1~/.bashrcexport PS1=×××~/.bash_profileshell~/.bashrc
  # Get the aliases and functions   if [ -f ~/.bashrc ]; then       . ~/.bashrc   fi
source ~/.bashrc   **1.3 ******
  alias ..="cd .."   alias ...="cd ../.."     alias cd..="cd .."   alias ll="ls -l"   alias la="ls -a"   alias tree="~/code/tree"
alias~/.bashrc~/code/treeshell
  #!/bin/sh   function tree_files()   {       find . -print 2>/dev/null|\       awk '!/\.$/ {for (i=1;i<NF;i++){\       d=length($i);if ( d < 5 && i != 1 )d=5;printf("%"d"s","|")}print "---"$NF}' \       FS='/' | more   }   function tree_dirs()   {       find . -type d -print 2>/dev/null|\       awk '!/\.$/ {for (i=1;i<NF;i++){\       d=length($i);if ( d < 5 && i != 1 )d=5;printf("%"d"s","|")}print "---"$NF}' \       FS='/' | more   }   function help()   {       echo "Usage: tree [-f|-d]"       echo "  -f: list files of current directory"       echo "  -d: list direcotries of current directory"   }   if [ $# = 0 ]; then       tree_dirs   elif [ $# = 1 ]; then       if [ $1 = "-f" ]; then           tree_files       elif [ $1 = "-d" ]; then           tree_dirs       else           help       fi   fi
  **1.4 ****** vim~/.vimrcsyntax onindent shell// > **BTW**tmuxvimmaketreeshell

**4.0 ****** **4.1 ****** OS > **BTW:** **:** &&ctrl+zbg(backgroud)
  >> $ /bin/sh your.sh &   [1]    pid        # pid   >> $ /bin/sh your.sh       # ctrl + z   [1]+  Stopped            /bin/sh your.sh   >> $ bg %1   # %1   [1]+  /bin/sh your.sh &
> **TIPS:** The plus sign shows the most recently invoked job; the minus sign shows the next most recently invoked job.- <Learning the Korn Shell, 2nd Edition> > > > **WARNING:** $ /bin/sh your.sh > ./your.log 2>&1 & **** fg(foreground)
  >> $ vim your_file      # ctrl + z   [1]+   Stopped            vim your_file   >> $ fg %1 
**** nohup
  >> $ nohup /bin/sh your.sh &   [1]    pid   nohup: appending output to ‘nohup.out'
disown
  >> $ /bin/sh your.sh &   [1]    pid   >> disown %1
> **REFE:** [**Linux******](http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/cn/linux/l-cn-nohup/)**** **screen:** screenscreen ANSI/VT100 screentmux screenscreenalias
alias s="screen" alias sr="screen -r"     # alias sl="screen -ls"     # alias sl="screen -d"     # ctrl+a :sessionname MyName   # screen ctrl+a :kill    # ctrl+a :encoding gbk     # screen ctrl+a d     # detached
> **TIPS**: screenlsscreenecho $TERMscreenscreen.linux/etc/DIR_COLORS/etc/DIR_COLORS~/.dir_colors"TERM screen" **jobs:** **ps:** **top:** winload averageLoad AverageCPULoad CPUCPUCPU CPUload average: 0.06, 0.60, 0.48 1515load average **Load Average < CPU * *0.7**
  >> $ top   ...   ...   >> $ top -p pid [-p pid2 ...]   ...    # pid
**crontab:**
>> $ crontab -e    # * * * * * cmd > /dev/null 2>&1     # 5*/dev/null */2 * * * * cmd > /dev/null 2>&1     # cmd >> $ crontab -l    # >> $ crontab -r    # - -
> **REFE:** [Crontab ](http://www.cnblogs.com/cosiray/archive/2012/03/09/2387361.html) **history:**
>> $ history | more >> $ history | grep ls >> $ vi ~/.bashrc HISTFILESIZE=2000     # history HISTTIMEFORMAT='%F %T '     #

**2.1 ****** ls(list), cd(change directory), rm(remove), touch, mkdir(make directory), rmdir(remove directory), pwd(print working dir) > **TIPS: **cd - > > > **WARNING:** rm -rf *rm   **2.2 ****** **find**find
  >> $ find -help   Usage: find [path] [expression](<option> <action>) # commented by wikie   >> $ find . -name "*.txt"    # "*.txt"   >> $ find . -type f|d|l    # ||   >> $ find . -size 1024(c)    # 1024   >> $ find . -maxdepth 1 -name "*.txt"    # 1   >> $ find . -a(m)time -1    # 24   >> $ find . -name "*.tmp" -exec(-ok) rm {} \;   # tmp-ok
> **TIPS1:** -exec find . | while read line; do do_sth to $line; done; > > > **TIPS2:** man find **locate****** locate“find -name”/var/lib/locatedbLinuxlocatelocateupdatedbroot
  >> $ locate your_file
**whereis:** whereis-bman-m-s
  >> $ whereis whereis   whereis: /usr/bin/whereis /usr/share/man/man1/whereis.1.gz
**which:** whichPATHwhich
  >> $ which gcc   /usr/bin/gcc
> **REFE: ** - [Linux](http://www.ruanyifeng.com/blog/2009/10/5_ways_to_search_for_files_using_the_terminal.html)   **2.3 ****** du(disk usage)df(disk free)-hhuman-readable
  >> $ du -sh .     # -s summay   10G     .   >> $ df -h   Filesystem            Size   Used   Avail   Use%   Mounted on   /dev/hda1             62G    21G    42G    34%     /   tmpfs                   502M    0     502M    0%     /dev/shm   >> $ df -ih          # -i inode usage   Filesystem            Inodes   IUsed   IFree   IUse%   Mounted on   /dev/hda1              63M      197K    62M    1%   /   tmpfs                    126K       1       126K    1%   /dev/shm
> **WARNING: **85%T_T…… > > > **TIPS:** dfstatfsdfdudf -h | grep mounted_disk | awk '{print $4}'   **2.4 ****** chmod(change mode), chown(change owner) chmod +x file   **2.5 ****** tarziptar
  >> $ tar zcvf file.tar.gz file                   # z gzip  c   >> $ tar zxvf file.tar.gz [-C untar_dir]
> **WARNING: **gzipcpu > > > **TIPS: **scpscp
  >> $ split --help   Usage: split [OPTION] [INPUT [PREFIX]]   >> $ split -b 1024b(k)(m) filename (splited_filename)   #   >> $ split -l 1000 filename (splited_filename)   #   >> $ cat splited_filename* > filename   #

Post.title: Les Miserables - Do You Hear the People Sing?
Post._content:
Do you hear the people sing?

	Singing a song of angry men?

	It is the music of a people

	Who will not be slaves again!

	When the beating of your heart

	Echoes the beating of the drums

	There is a life about to start

	When tomorrow comes!

<!--more-->

	Will you join in our crusade?

	Who will be strong and stand with me?

	Beyond the barricade

	Is there a world you long to see?

	Then join in the fight

	That will give you the right to be free!

	Do you hear the people sing?

	Singing a song of angry men?

	It is the music of a people

	Who will not be slaves again!

	When the beating of your heart

	Echoes the beating of the drums

	There is a life about to start

	When tomorrow comes!

	Will you give all you can give

	So that our banner may advance

	Some will fall and some will live

	Will you stand up and take your chance?

	The blood of the martyrs

	Will water the meadows of France!

	Do you hear the people sing?

	Singing a song of angry men?

	It is the music of a people

	Who will not be slaves again!

	When the beating of your heart

	Echoes the beating of the drums

	There is a life about to start

	When tomorrow comes!

extends TokenIdentifier> secretManager)    4.     throws IOException {   5.     this.bindAddress = bindAddress;   6.     this.conf = conf;   7.     this.port = port;   8.     this.paramClass = paramClass;   9.     this.handlerCount = handlerCount;   10.     this.socketSendBufferSize = 0;   11.     this.maxQueueSize = handlerCount * conf.getInt(   12.                                 IPC_SERVER_HANDLER_QUEUE_SIZE_KEY,   13.                                 IPC_SERVER_HANDLER_QUEUE_SIZE_DEFAULT);   14.     this.maxRespSize = conf.getInt(IPC_SERVER_RPC_MAX_RESPONSE_SIZE_KEY,   15.                                    IPC_SERVER_RPC_MAX_RESPONSE_SIZE_DEFAULT);   16.     this.readThreads = conf.getInt(   17.         IPC_SERVER_RPC_READ_THREADS_KEY,   18.         IPC_SERVER_RPC_READ_THREADS_DEFAULT);   19.     this.callQueue  = new LinkedBlockingQueue<Call>(maxQueueSize);    20.     this.maxIdleTime = 2*conf.getInt("ipc.client.connection.maxidletime", 1000);   21.     this.maxConnectionsToNuke = conf.getInt("ipc.client.kill.max", 10);   22.     this.thresholdIdleConnections = conf.getInt("ipc.client.idlethreshold", 4000);   23.     this.secretManager = (SecretManager<TokenIdentifier>) secretManager;   24.     this.authorize =    25.       conf.getBoolean(HADOOP_SECURITY_AUTHORIZATION, false);   26.     this.isSecurityEnabled = UserGroupInformation.isSecurityEnabled();   27.        28.     // Start the listener here and let it bind to the port   29.     listener = new Listener();   30.     this.port = listener.getAddress().getPort();       31.     this.rpcMetrics = RpcInstrumentation.create(serverName, this.port);   32.     this.tcpNoDelay = conf.getBoolean("ipc.server.tcpnodelay", false);   33.   34.     // Create the responder here   35.     responder = new Responder();   36.        37.     if (isSecurityEnabled) {   38.       SaslRpcServer.init(conf);   39.     }   40.   }

1. void doAccept(SelectionKey key) throws IOException,  OutOfMemoryError {   2.       Connection c = null;   3.       ServerSocketChannel server = (ServerSocketChannel) key.channel();   4.       SocketChannel channel;   5.       while ((channel = server.accept()) != null) {   6.         channel.configureBlocking(false);   7.         channel.socket().setTcpNoDelay(tcpNoDelay);   8.         Reader reader = getReader();   9.         try {   10.           reader.startAdd();  // readSelectoraddingtrue   11.           SelectionKey readKey = reader.registerChannel(channel);   12.           c = new Connection(readKey, channel, System.currentTimeMillis());   13.           readKey.attach(c);   14.           synchronized (connectionList) {   15.             connectionList.add(numConnections, c);   16.             numConnections++;   17.           }   18.                       19.         } finally {   20.           reader.finishAdd(); // addaddingfalseReader   21.         }   22.     }   23. }

1. public int readAndProcess() throws IOException, InterruptedException {   2. // RPC   3. //      4. while (true) {    5.         int count = -1;   6.         if (dataLengthBuffer.remaining() > 0) {   7.           count = channelRead(channel, dataLengthBuffer);          8.              9.         if (!rpcHeaderRead) {   10.           //.   11.           if (rpcHeaderBuffer == null) {   12.             rpcHeaderBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(2);   13.           }   14.           count = channelRead(channel, rpcHeaderBuffer);   15.           if (count < 0 || rpcHeaderBuffer.remaining() > 0) {   16.             return count;   17.           }   18.           //   19.           int version = rpcHeaderBuffer.get(0);   20.           byte[] method = new byte[] {rpcHeaderBuffer.get(1)};   21.           authMethod = AuthMethod.read(new DataInputStream(   22.               new ByteArrayInputStream(method)));   23.           dataLengthBuffer.flip();             24.              25.           dataLengthBuffer.clear();   26.              27.              28.           rpcHeaderBuffer = null;   29.           rpcHeaderRead = true;   30.           continue;   31.         }    32.            33.           data = ByteBuffer.allocate(dataLength);   34.         }   35.            36.         //   37.         count = channelRead(channel, data);   38.            39.         if (data.remaining() == 0) {   40.              41.           if (useSasl) {   42.             saslReadAndProcess(data.array());   43.           } else {   44.             // RPCheaderparam   45.             processOneRpc(data.array());   46.           }   47.              48.         }    49.         return count;   50.       }   51.     }

Post._content:
## Docker 

docker  docker  docker  volume  network  network  volume 

 docker daemon  host  Plugin Discovery 

* 
* 

<!-- more -->

## 

 docker 

* `.sock`  UNIX domain sockets
* `.spec`  URL`unix:///other.sock`
* `.json`  JSON 

UNIX domain socket  `/run/docker/plugins`  `.spec``.json`  `/etc/docker/plugins`  `/usr/lib/docker/plugins` 

 `/run/docker/plugins/myplugin.sock`  `myplugin` `/run/docker/plugins/myplugin/myplugin.sock`

docker  `/run/docker/plugins`  unix socket  `/etc/docker/plugins`  `/usr/lib/docker/plugins`

### `.json`

JSON 

```
{
  "Name": "plugin-example",
  "Addr": "https://example.com/docker/plugin",
  "TLSConfig": {
    "InsecureSkipVerify": false,
    "CAFile": "/usr/shared/docker/certs/example-ca.pem",
    "CertFile": "/usr/shared/docker/certs/example-cert.pem",
    "KeyFile": "/usr/shared/docker/certs/example-key.pem",
  }
}
```

## 

* 
*  docker
*  docker
* 


## 

 `docker run --volume-driver=foo`  `foo`  volume 

## volume 



```
$ docker run -ti -v volumename:/data --volume-driver=flocker busybox sh
```

 flocker  voluemname  /data 

volumename  `/`  docker  `/` 

##  API 

 API  HTTP  JSON POST  HTTP  bind  UNIX socket API  HTTP
`application/vnd.docker.plugins.v1+json`

 docker  docker volume  API [docker-volume-extension-api](https://github.com/calavera/dkvolume)

### `/Plugin.Activate`





```json
{
  "Implements:" ["VolumeDriver"]
}
```

 volume 

### `/VolumeDriver.Create`



```
{
    "Name": "volume_name"
}
```

 volume volume 



```
{
    "Err": null
}
```



### `/VolumeDriver.Remove`

```

    "Name": "volume_name"
}
```



```

    "Err": null
}
```


### `/VolumeDriver.Mount`



```
{
    "Name": "volume_name"
}
```





```
{
   "Mountpoint": "/path/to/directory/on/host",
   "Err": null
}
```

 volume_name  docker


### `/VolumeDriver.Path`



```
{
    "Name": "volume_name"
}
```



```
{
   "Mountpoint": "/path/to/directory/on/host",
   "Err": null
}
```

```
{
    "Name": "volume_name"
}
```


**GOF****** _Avoid coupling thesender of a request to its receiver by giving more than one object a chance to handle the request. Chain the receiving objects and pass the request along the chain until an object handles it _ __ VIP1-67
1. package com.wikieno.chainofresponsibility;   2.   3. public abstract class Speeder {   4.     protected Speeder next;   5.   6.     public void setNext(Speeder next) {   7.         Speeder tmp = this;   8.         while (null != tmp.next) {   9.             tmp = tmp.next;   10.         }   11.         tmp.next = next;   12.         tmp = null;   13.     }   14.   15.     /**  16.      *  17.      *   18.      * @return  19.      */  20.     public boolean hasNext() {   21.         if (null != next) {   22.             return true;   23.         }   24.         return false;   25.     }   26.   27.     public abstract void speed(User user);   28.     public abstract boolean canHandle(User user);   29. }  
1. package com.wikieno.chainofresponsibility;   2.   3. public class SimpleSpeeder extends Speeder {   4.   5.     @Override  6.     public void speed(User user) {   7.         if (canHandle(user)) {   8.             // TODO   9.         } else {   10.             if (hasNext()) {   11.                 next.speed(user);   12.             }   13.         }   14.     }   15.   16.     @Override  17.     public boolean canHandle(User user) {   18.         if (!user.isVIP) {   19.             return true;   20.         }   21.         return false;   22.     }   23. }  
VIP1
1. package com.wikieno.chainofresponsibility;   2.   3. public class VIP1Speeder extends Speeder {   4.   5.     public static int LEVEL = 1;   6.   7.     @Override  8.     public void speed(User user) {   9.         if (canHandle(user)) {   10.             // TODO   11.             System.out.println(1+"");   12.         } else {   13.             if (hasNext()) {   14.                 next.speed(user);   15.             }   16.         }   17.     }   18.   19.     @Override  20.     public boolean canHandle(User user) {   21.         if (LEVEL == user.levelVIP) {   22.             return true;   23.         }   24.         return false;   25.     }   26. }  
VIP2LEVEL
1. package com.wikieno.chainofresponsibility;   2.   3. public class Application {   4.     public static void main(String[] args) {   5.         User user = new User();   6.         user.isVIP = true;   7.         user.levelVIP = 2;   8.         Speeder speeder = new SimpleSpeeder();   9.         speeder.setNext(new VIP1Speeder());   10.         speeder.setNext(new VIP2Speeder());   11.            12.         speeder.speed(user);   13.     }   14. }

Post.title: README
Post._content:
# 

 [hexo](https://hexo.io/zh-cn/)

```
$ npm install hexo-cli -g
$ hexo init blog
$ cd blog
$ npm install
$ hexo server
```


# 

 [NexT](http://theme-next.iissnan.com/)

```
$ cd your-hexo-site
$ git clone https://github.com/iissnan/hexo-theme-next themes/next
```


 [github ](https://github.com/iissnan/hexo-theme-next)  zip 


#  github pages

 git : [](https://hexo.io/zh-cn/docs/deployment.html)

* 


```
$ npm install hexo-deployer-git --save
```

*  `_config.yml`  deploy 

```
deploy:
  type: git
  repo: https://github.com/hongweiyi/hongweiyi.github.io.git
```

* 

```
$ hexo deploy
```
